short_summary: Grass Cutting 3 - Gagetown (Base - G, H, J, K Zones, partial M Zone, Fredericton armory, and airstrip 1)
description: The Canadian government is looking for a contractor to provide lawn maintenance services at the Department of National Defence base in Gagetown.
full_summary:
**Title**

**Grass Cutting Services 3 - Gagetown**
**Tonte de pelouse No 3 - Gagetown**

**Reference Number (Contract)**

* WS3950795228

**Introduction**

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking to hire a contractor to provide grass cutting services at the Canadian Forces Base Gagetown in New Brunswick. The services are expected to start on May 17, 2023, and may continue indefinitely. This solicitation is a request for proposal, with the goal of awarding a contract based on the lowest price.

**Scope of Work**

The contract will involve providing all necessary labour, materials, and equipment to maintain the grass cutting and groundskeeping services at the following sites:

* Zones G, H, J, K, and a portion of Zone M at CFB Gagetown
* Fredericton Armory
* Airstrip 1

The work will include cutting grass, removing debris, and performing landscaping services as needed.

**Lot Structure**

This is a single lot contract, with one bid being accepted.

**Bidder Requirements**

Offerors must be able to provide a comprehensive services proposal, including rates, supplies, and equipment requirements. They must also demonstrate experience and proficiency in providing similar services.

**Compliance with Trade Agreements**

Offerors must demonstrate compliance with the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and other applicable trade agreements.

**Contact Information**

The contact person for this solicitation is Nicole Fesseha, who can be reached by email at nicole.fesseha@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Bid Documents**

The bid documents and solicitation can be downloaded from the following link: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16045383

**Closing Information**

Tender submissions are due on May 16, 2023, at 14:00 Eastern Standard Time. Late bids will not be accepted.

Note: I rewrote the entire text to present the most relevant and necessary information, removing any redundant details. The tone and language used are more professional and formal, as required by a government document. I reformatted the text to make it more readable and easier to follow. I also removed any excessive details or URLs not necessary for the solicitation. The rewritten text meets the 400-word limit.*/
